head.supplied: Colonial Botanists Office ¶ July 9th [189]2 ¶ Dear Baron ¶ ¶ I have again to thank you for specimens of new species of plants. You know how highly I value specimens of such plants as from time to tim...

div.p: Letter press copy book 2, p. 119, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have again to thank you for specimens of new species of plants. You know how highly I value specimens of such plants as from time to time come to your hands from N.S. Wales near our border or within Queensland. And I hope you will at all times let me have such be it ever such a fragment. My Bulletin (No 5)
Bailey (1892) is dated May 1892 on the title page, as is Bailey's preface. has been greatly delayed but I shall be able to send you a copy shortly and if you find that I have neglected to furnish you with examples of any of the new species recorded let me know and if possible I will send a specimen.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
